MeDIP-Seq pipeline¶

Author:

David Sims
Release:

$Id$
Date:

April 02, 2014
Tags:

Python

  1. Align to genome using gapped alignment (BWA)
  2. Calculate alignment and coverage statistics (BAMStats)
  3. Identify differentially methylated regions (DMRs)
  4. Filter DMRs
  5. Calculate DMR statistics
  6. Produce report (SphinxReport)

Methods¶

Read processing¶

For medip-seq analysis, the following filtering steps are typically applied to the mapped data:

  1. removing duplicate reads
  2. removing reads with a mapping quality of less than 10

Medip analysis¶

The medip analysis makes use of the MEDIPS R package by Chavez et al. (see :pmid:`20802089`).

Briefly, the data is processed in the following way:

  1. Quality control 1. Saturation analysis 2. Computing CpG coverage 3. Computing CpG enrichment
  2. Normalization 1. Output data normalized by total read depth (rpm - reads per million) 2. Output normalized relative methylation scores (rms) 3. Output normalized absolute methylation scores (ams)

Usage¶

See Setting up a pipeline and Running a pipeline on general information how to use CGAT pipelines.

Configuration¶

Input¶

Reads are imported by placing files or linking to files in the working directory.

The default file format assumes the following convention:

<sample>-<condition>-<replicate>.<suffix>

sample and condition make up an experiment, while replicate denotes the replicate within an experiment. The suffix determines the file type. The following suffixes/file types are possible:

sra
Short-Read Archive format. Reads will be extracted using the fastq-dump tool.
fastq.gz
Single-end reads in fastq format.
fastq.1.gz, fastq2.2.gz
Paired-end reads in fastq format. The two fastq files must be sorted by read-pair.

Note

Quality scores need to be of the same scale for all input files. Thus it might be difficult to mix different formats.

Requirements¶

On top of the default CGAT setup, the pipeline requires the following software to be in the path:

Program Version Purpose
Stampy >=0.9.0 read mapping
BWA   read mapping
SAMtools   filtering, SNV / indel calling
BEDTools   filtering, SNV / indel calling
sra-tools   extracting reads from .sra files
picard >=1.38
bam/sam files. The .jar files need to be in your
CLASSPATH environment variable.
vcf-tools    
BAMStats

?

Code¶

pipeline_medip.connect()¶

connect to database.

This method also attaches to helper databases.

pipeline_medip.trimReads(infile, outfile)¶

trim reads with FastX

pipeline_medip.makeTrackDirectories(infile, outfile)¶

make track directories.

pipeline_medip.mapReads(infiles, outfile)¶

Map reads to the genome using BWA

pipeline_medip.prepareBAMs(infile, outfile)¶

filter bam files for medip-seq analysis.

Optional steps include:

  • deduplication - remove duplicate reads
  • quality score filtering - remove reads below a certain quality score.
pipeline_medip.loadPicardDuplicateStats(infiles, outfile)¶

Merge Picard duplicate stats into single table and load into SQLite.

pipeline_medip.buildPicardAlignmentStats(infile, outfile)¶

Gather BAM file alignment statistics using Picard

pipeline_medip.loadPicardAlignmentStats(infiles, outfile)¶

Merge Picard alignment stats into single table and load into SQLite.

pipeline_medip.buildPicardGCStats(infile, outfile)¶

Gather BAM file GC bias stats using Picard

pipeline_medip.loadPicardGCStats(infiles, outfile)¶

Merge Picard insert size stats into single table and load into SQLite.

pipeline_medip.buildBAMStats(infile, outfile)¶

Count number of reads mapped, duplicates, etc.

pipeline_medip.loadBAMStats(infiles, outfile)¶

Import bam statistics into SQLite

pipeline_medip.runMEDIPS(infile, outfile)¶

run MEDIPS analysis - outputs methylation profiles.

pipeline_medip.loadMEDIPS(infile, outfile)¶

load medips results

pipeline_medip.buildCoverageBed(infile, outfile)¶

build bed file with regions covered by reads.

Intervals containing only few reads (tiling_min_reads) are removed.

pipeline_medip.buildCpGCoverage(infiles, outfile)¶

count number times certain CpG are covered by reads.

Reads are processed in the same way as by buildCoverageBed.

pipeline_medip.loadCpGCoverage(infiles, outfile)¶

load cpg coverag data.

pipeline_medip.buildVariableWidthTiles(infiles, outfile)¶

bed file with intervals that are covered by reads in any of the experiments.

pipeline_medip.buildNonoverlappingFixedWidthTiles(infile, outfile)¶

Build bed file segmenting entire genome using window x and shift y

pipeline_medip.buildOverlappingFixedWidthTiles(infile, outfile)¶

Build bed file segmenting entire genome using window x and shift y

pipeline_medip.buildTileStats(infile, outfile)¶

compute tiling window size statistics from bed file.

pipeline_medip.buildBigBed(infile, outfile)¶

bed file with intervals that are covered by reads in any of the experiments.

pipeline_medip.buildTiledReadCounts(infiles, outfile)¶

compute coverage of genome with reads.

pipeline_medip.buildTiledReadCountsVariableWidth(infiles, outfile)¶

build read counds for variable width windows.

pipeline_medip.buildTiledReadCountsFixedWidthNoOverlap(infiles, outfile)¶

build read counds for fixed width windows.

pipeline_medip.buildTiledReadCountsFixedWidthOverlap(infiles, outfile)¶

build read counds for fixed width windows.

pipeline_medip.aggregateTiledReadCounts(infiles, outfile)¶

aggregate tag counts for each window.

coverageBed outputs the following columns: 1) Contig 2) Start 3) Stop 4) Name 5) The number of features in A that overlapped (by at least one base pair) the B interval. 6) The number of bases in B that had non-zero coverage from features in A. 7) The length of the entry in B. 8) The fraction of bases in B that had non-zero coverage from features in A.

For bed: use column 5 For bed6: use column 7 For bed12: use column 13

This method uses the maximum number of reads found in any interval as the tag count.

Tiles with no counts will not be output.

pipeline_medip.loadMethylationData(infile, design_file)¶

load methylation data for deseq/edger analysis.

This method creates various R objects:

countsTable : data frame with counts. groups : vector with groups

pipeline_medip.runDE(infiles, outfile, method)¶

run DESeq or EdgeR.

The job is split into smaller sections. The order of the input data is randomized in order to avoid any biases due to chromosomes.

pipeline_medip.runDESeq(infiles, outfile)¶

estimate differential expression using DESeq.

The final output is a table. It is slightly edited such that it contains a similar output and similar fdr compared to cuffdiff.

pipeline_medip.runEdgeR(infiles, outfile)¶

estimate differential methylation using EdgeR

This method applies a paired test. The analysis follows the example in chapter 11 of the EdgeR manual.

pipeline_medip.mergeDMRWindows(infile, outfile)¶

merge overlapping windows.

pipeline_medip.loadDMRWindows(infile, outfile)¶

merge overlapping windows.

pipeline_medip.buildDMRStats(infiles, outfile)¶

compute differential methylation stats.

pipeline_medip.loadDMRStats(infile, outfile)¶

load DMR stats into table.

pipeline_medip.buildDMRWindowStats(infile, outfile)¶

compute tiling window size statistics from bed file.

pipeline_medip.loadTileStats(infiles, outfile)¶

load tiling stats into database.

pipeline_medip.buildDMRBed(infile, outfile)¶

output bed6 file with differentially methylated regions.

Overlapping/book-ended entries are merged.

The score is the average log fold change.

pipeline_medip.computeDMROverlap(infiles, outfile)¶

compute overlap between bed sets.

pipeline_medip.buildMRBed(infile, outfile)¶

output bed6 file with methylated regions.

All regions are output, even the insignificant ones.

The score is the log fold change.

pipeline_medip.build_report()¶

build report from scratch.

pipeline_medip.update_report()¶

update report.

pipeline_medip.publish()¶

publish files.
